alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:56PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kit Carson County through 430 PM MDT... At 356 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm producing a landspout 6 miles north of Stratton, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Kit Carson County. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
